findings.title: H01. Requirements Violation
findings.description: The implementation of the system or function does not adhere to the high-level, broad system, technical, or functional requirements.

findings.title: L01. Floating Pragma
findings.description: Contracts should be deployed with the same compiler version and flags that they have been tested thoroughly.

findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used. Contracts shouldn’t rely on values that can be changed in the same transaction.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the Customer.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Transaction execution costs should not depend dramatically on the amount of data stored on the contract. There should not be any cases when execution fails due to the block Gas limit.

findings.title: Style Guide Violation
findings.description: Functions and state variables visibility should be set explicitly. Visibility levels should be specified consciously.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: The implementation of the system or function does not adhere to the high-level, broad system, technical, or functional requirements.

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: Consider locking the pragma version whenever possible and avoid using a floating pragma in the final deployment. Consider known bugs for the compiler version that is chosen.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: The tests do not cover interactions by several users and fail due to compilation errors based on configuration.

findings.title: Default Visibility
findings.description: Functions and state variables visibility should be set explicitly. Visibility levels should be specified consciously.

findings.title: Integer Overflow and Underflow
findings.description: If unchecked math is used, all math operations should be safe from overflows and underflows.

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: It is recommended to use a recent version of the Solidity compiler.

findings.title: Unchecked Call Return Value
findings.description: The return value of a message call should be checked.

findings.title: Access Control & Authorization
findings.description: Ownership takeover should not be possible. All crucial functions should be protected. Users could not affect data that belongs to other users.

findings.title: SELFDESTRUCT Instruction
findings.description: The contract should not be self-destructible while it has funds belonging to users.

findings.title: Check-Effect- Interaction
findings.description: Check-Effect-Interaction pattern should be followed if the code performs ANY external call.

findings.title: Assert Violation
findings.description: Properly functioning code should never reach a failing assert statement.

findings.title: Deprecated Solidity Functions
findings.description: Deprecated built-in functions should never be used.

findings.title: Delegatecall to Untrusted Callee
findings.description: Delegatecalls should only be allowed to trusted addresses.
